entry.title: Maximum Subarray in Blind 75 (5)
entry.content:
Maximum Subarray

Description

Given an integer array nums, find the contiguous subarray (containing at least one number) which has the largest sum and return its sum.

Example 1

Input: nums = [-2,1,-3,4,-1,2,1,-5,4]
Output: 6
Explanation: [4,-1,2,1] has the largest sum = 6.

Example 2

Input: nums = [1]
Output: 1

Example 3

Input: nums = [5,4,-1,7,8]
Output: 23

Constraints

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 3 * 10^4
  • -10^5 <= nums[i] <= 10^5

Thoughts

Use simple DP to solve this problem. The key is to find the relationship between the current element and the previous element.

  1. In local_max, we can either add the current element(nums[i]) to the previous element(local_max) or just use the current element(nums[i]).
  • if we add the current element to the previous element,it represents that we are still in the same subarray,and the current element is the last element of the subarray.
  • if we just use the current element, it represents that we are starting a new subarray.
  1. In global_max,to get the maximum subarray, we just need to compare the current local_max with the previous global_max.

complexity: O(n)

Code

Discussion

  1. Determine nums[i] is suitable for being the first numberã€‚å¦‚æœmax()é¸äº†nums[i]ï¼Œä»£è¡¨ié€™å€‹ä½ç½®é©åˆç•¶ç¬¬ä¸€ä½æ•¸å­—;å¦‚æœé¸äº†nums[i]+local_maxï¼Œä»£è¡¨å¯å»¶çºŒä¸‹å»ï¼Œé€™æ™‚çš„nums[i]ç‚ºç­”æ¡ˆé™£åˆ—çš„ç¬¬äºŒä½ã€‚

  2. If last number is negative,the local_max will choose to be in the same array,so original sum will be smaller.Thus,we need to have the global_max to compare with the local_max.

Tips & Concepts

Array=[-2,-3,4,-1,-2,1,5,-3]

entry.title: Maximum Product Subarray in Blind 75 (6)
entry.content:
Maximum Product Subarray

Description

Given an integer array nums , find a contiguous non-empty subarray within the array that has the largest product, and return the product.

Example 1

Input: nums = [2,3,-2,4]
Output: 6
Explanation: [2,3] has the largest product 6.

Example 2

Input: nums = [-2,0,-1]
Output: 0
Explanation: The result cannot be 2, because [-2,-1] is not a subarray.

Constraints

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 2 * 10^4
  • -10 <= nums[i] <= 10
  • The product of any prefix or suffix of nums is guaranteed to fit in a 32-bit integer.

Thoughts

Use simple DP to solve this problem. The key is to find the relationship between the current element and the previous element.If we met a negative number, we need to swap the max and min.

Code

Discussion

Similar to Maximum Subarray

Tips & Concepts

  1. std::swap (No return value)

swap(a,b) è©²å‡½æ•¸æ¥å—å…©å€‹å¿…é ˆäº¤æ›çš„å¿…éœ€åƒæ•¸aå’Œbã€‚åƒæ•¸å¯ä»¥æ˜¯ä»»ä½•æ•¸æ“šé¡å‹(int , stringâ€¦)ã€‚

entry.title: Two Sum in Blind 75 (1)
entry.content:
Two Sum

Description

Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution , and you may not use the same element twice.

You can return the answer in any order.

Example 1

Input: nums = [2,7,11,15], target = 9
Output: [0,1]
Explanation: Because nums[0] + nums[1] == 9, we return [0, 1].

Example 2

Input: nums = [3,2,4], target = 6
Output: [1,2]

Example 3

Input: nums = [3,3], target = 6
Output: [0,1]

Constraints

  • 2 <= nums.length <= 10^4
  • -10^9 <= nums[i] <= 10^9
  • -10^9 <= target <= 10^9
  • Only one valid answer exists.

Thoughts

We can use a Hashmap to store the value and index of each element in the array. Then we can iterate through the array and check if the target minus the current element is in the Hashmap. If it is, we return the index of the current element and the index of the element in the hash table. If not, we add the current element and its index to the Hashmap.

Time Complicity: O(n)

Codeâ€“V1

Codeâ€“V2(with const auto&)

Discussion

Tips & Concepts

entry.title: Product of Array Except Self in Blind 75 (4)
entry.content:
Product of Array Except Self

Description

Given an integer array nums, return an array answer such that answer[i] is equal to the product of all the elements of nums except nums[i].

The product of any prefix or suffix of nums is guaranteed to fit in a 32-bit integer.

You must write an algorithm that runs in O(n) time and without using the division operation.

Example 1

Input: nums = [1,2,3,4]
Output: [24,12,8,6]

Example 2

Input: nums = [-1,1,0,-3,3]
Output: [0,0,9,0,0]

Constraints

  • 2 <= nums.length <= 10^5
  • -30 <= nums[i] <= 30
  • The product of any prefix or suffix of nums is guaranteed to fit in a 32-bit integer.

Thoughts

we can use two vectors to store the product of the elements before and after the current element. Then we can iterate through the array and multiply the product of the elements before and after the current element to get the answer.

Code

Tips & Concepts

  1. vector<int> v1(10); ç”¢ç”Ÿä¸€å€‹é•·åº¦ç‚º10çš„vectorï¼Œä¸¦ä¸”åˆå§‹åŒ–ç‚º0
  2. vector<int> v2(10, 1); ç”¢ç”Ÿä¸€å€‹é•·åº¦ç‚º10çš„vectorï¼Œä¸¦ä¸”åˆå§‹åŒ–ç‚º1
  3. vector<int> v3={10,20,30,40,50};/n vector<int> v4(v3); ä»¥ v3 ä½œç‚ºå¼•æ•¸ä¾†å»ºæ§‹ v4
  4. vector<int> v5(v3.begin(),v3.begin()+2); ä»¥ v3 çš„å‰å…©å€‹å…ƒç´ ä¾†å»ºæ§‹ v5

v3.begin()+2 ä»£è¡¨å¾ v3 çš„ç¬¬ 0 å€‹å…ƒç´ é–‹å§‹ï¼Œå– 2 å€‹å…ƒç´ (ç¬¬ä¸‰å€‹ä¸ç®—)

  1. vector<int> v6(v3.end()-2,v3.end()); ä»¥ v3 çš„å¾Œå…©å€‹å…ƒç´ ä¾†å»ºæ§‹ v6

entry.title: Contains Duplicate in Blind 75 (3)
entry.content:
Contains Duplicate

Description

Given an integer array nums, return true if any value appears at least twice in the array, and return false if every element is distinct.

Example 1

Input: nums = [1,2,3,1]
Output: true

Example 2

Input: nums = [1,2,3,4]
Output: false

Example 3

Input: nums = [1,1,1,3,3,4,3,2,4,2]
Output: true

Constraints

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 10^5
  • -10^9 <= nums[i] <= 10^9

Thoughts

We can use a map to store the value and index of each element in the array. Then we can iterate through the array and check if the current element is in the map. If it is, we return true. If not, we add the current element and its index to the map.

use map.insert() to insert a pair into the map.

  1. If the key already exists, it will return a pair with the iterator pointing to the existing element and a bool value of false.
  2. If the key does not exist, it will return a pair with the iterator pointing to the new element and a bool value of true.

Code

Discussion

Q1. why we use !retPair.second instead of retPair.second?
A1. if retPair.second is false,it means the element already exists in the map,so return true

Tips & Concepts

  1. use map.insert() to insert a pair into the map.

map.insert(pair<int,int>(nums[i],i));

  1. pairâ€™s usage in map (elementary)

entry.title: CH1 èªè­˜Cèªè¨€
entry.content:
Why C?ğŸ‘

IEEE spectrum (IEEEç¶œè¦½) comes with the listing sheet of topğŸ” programming language 2021. The list of the programming language is based on popularity.

C can help!ğŸ’ğŸ»

1. Need to write high-performance code for a new game
2. Program an Arduino
3. use that advanced third-party library in your iPhone app
4. C is a language for small, fast programs

C works at a much lower-level than most other languages

it creates code that is a lot closer to what machines really understand ğŸ’¡

ğŸ” Understanding C gives you a much better idea of what is really going on
ğŸ” C can even help you better understand other languages as well

Câ€™s history of development

  • C was developed at AT&T Bell Laboratories in the early 1970s
  • C was derived from a language called B, hence the name C to indicate it is a successor of language B(BCPL)

    The B language cannot handle these objects of different sizes, nor does it provide a separate operator to operate on them.

The characteristics of C

  • Cèªè¨€å¯ä»¥ç›´æ¥ä¾ è¨˜æ†¶é«”çš„ä½å€ä¾†å­˜å–è®Šæ•¸ ï¼Œä»¥æé«˜ç¨‹å¼åŸ·è¡Œçš„æ•ˆç‡

The way C works

1. Source:

You start off by creating a source file.The source file contains human-readable C code.

2. Compile:

You run your source code through a compiler.The compiler checks for errors,and once itâ€™s happy,it compiles the source code.

3. Output:

The compiler creates a new file called an executable.This file contains machine code,a stream of 1s and 0s that the computer understands.And thatâ€™s the program you can run.
